refnamediv.refpurpose: a mixin implementation of the text channel type and the Messages interface

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This mixin can be added to a channel GObject class to implement the text channel type (with the Messages interface) in a general way. The channel class should also have a TpDBusPropertiesMixinClass.

To use the messages mixin, include a TpMessageMixin somewhere in your instance structure, and call tp_message_mixin_init() from your constructor function, and tp_message_mixin_finalize() from your dispose or finalize function. In the class_init function, call tp_message_mixin_init_dbus_properties() to hook this mixin into the D-Bus properties mixin class. Finally, include the following in the fourth argument of G_DEFINE_TYPE_WITH_CODE():
To support sending messages, you must call tp_message_mixin_implement_sending() in the constructor function. If you do not, any attempt to send a message will fail with NotImplemented.

refsect2.title: TpMessage
refsect2.para: Opaque structure representing a message in the Telepathy messages interface (an array of at least one mapping from string to variant, where the first mapping contains message headers and subsequent mappings contain the message body).

refsect2.title: tp_message_append_part ()
refsect2.para: Append a body part to the message.

listitem.simpara: a message

the part number
since 0.7.21
a message

the number of parts in the message, including the headers in part 0
since 0.7.21

refsect2.title: tp_message_delete_key ()
refsect2.para: Remove the given key and its value from the given part.

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part

TRUE if the key previously existed
since 0.7.21

refsect2.title: tp_message_delete_part ()
refsect2.para: Delete the given body part from the message.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly greater than 0, and strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()

refsect2.title: tp_message_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Destroy self.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message

refsect2.title: tp_message_new ()

listitem.simpara: a connection on which to reference handles
number of parts to create (at least 1)
preallocate space for this many parts (at least initial_parts)

a newly allocated message suitable to be passed to tp_message_mixin_take_received
since 0.7.21
a message
a part number

the GHashTable used to implement the given part, or NULL if the part number is out of range. The hash table is only valid as long as the message is valid and the part is not deleted.
since 0.7.21

refsect2.title: tp_message_ref_handle ()
refsect2.para: Reference the given handle until this message is destroyed.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a handle type, greater than TP_HANDLE_TYPE_NONE and less than NUM_TP_HANDLE_TYPES
a handle of the given type

refsect2.title: tp_message_set ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, const GValue *source);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have a copy of source as its value.
If source represents a data structure containing handles, they should all be referenced with tp_message_ref_handle() first.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
a value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_boolean ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_boolean (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, gboolean b);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have b as a boolean value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
a boolean value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_bytes ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_bytes (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, guint len, gconstpointer bytes);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have bytes as a byte-array value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
a number of bytes
an array of len bytes

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_handle ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_handle (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, TpHandleType handle_type, TpHandle handle_or_0);
refsect2.para: If handle_or_0 is not zero, reference it with tp_message_ref_handle().
Set key in part part of self to have handle_or_0 as an unsigned integer value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
a handle type
a handle of that type, or 0

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_int16()
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have i as a signed integer value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
an integer value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_int32 ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_int32 (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, gint32 i);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have i as a signed integer value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
an integer value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_int64 ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_int64 (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, gint64 i);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have i as a signed integer value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
an integer value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_string (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, const gchar *s);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have s as a string value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
a string value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_string_printf ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_string_printf (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, const gchar *fmt, ...);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have a string value constructed from a printf-style format string.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
a printf-style format string for the string value
arguments for the format string

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_uint16()
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have u as an unsigned integer value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
an unsigned integer value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_uint32 ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_uint32 (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, guint32 u);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have u as an unsigned integer value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
an unsigned integer value

refsect2.title: tp_message_set_uint64 ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_set_uint64 (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, guint64 u);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have u as an unsigned integer value.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
an unsigned integer value

refsect2.title: tp_message_take_message ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_take_message (TpMessage *self, guint part, const gchar *key, TpMessage *message);
refsect2.para: Set key in part part of self to have message as an aa{sv} value (that is, an array of Message_Part), and take ownership of message. The caller should not use message after passing it to this function. All handle references owned by message will subsequently belong to and be released with self.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: a message
a part number, which must be strictly less than the number returned by tp_message_count_parts()
a key in the mapping representing the part
another (distinct) message created for the same TpBaseConnection

refsect2.title: TpMessageMixin
refsect2.para: Structure to be included in the instance structure of objects that use this mixin. Initialize it with tp_message_mixin_init().
There are no public fields.
since 0.7.21

refsect2.title: TpMessageMixinSendImpl ()
refsect2.para: Signature of a virtual method which may be implemented to allow messages to be sent. It must arrange for tp_message_mixin_sent() to be called when the message has submitted or when message submission has failed.

listitem.simpara: An instance of the implementation that uses this mixin
An outgoing message
flags with which to send the message

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_finalize ()
refsect2.para: Free resources held by the text mixin.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin.

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_implement_sending ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_mixin_implement_sending (GObject *object, TpMessageMixinSendImpl send, guint n_types, const TpChannelTextMessageType *types, TpMessagePartSupportFlags message_part_support_flags, TpDeliveryReportingSupportFlags delivery_reporting_support_flags, const gchar * const *supported_content_types);
refsect2.para: Set the callback used to implement SendMessage, and the types of message that can be sent. This must be called from the init, constructor or constructed callback, after tp_message_mixin_init(), and may only be called once per object.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: An instance of the implementation that uses this mixin
An implementation of SendMessage()
Number of supported message types
n_types supported message types
Flags indicating what message part structures are supported
Flags indicating what kind of delivery reports are supported
The supported content types

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_init ()
refsect2.para: Initialize the mixin. Should be called from the implementation's instance init function or constructor like so:
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: An instance of the implementation that uses this mixin
The byte offset of the TpMessageMixin within the object structure
A TpBaseConnection

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_init_dbus_properties ()
refsect2.para: Set up a TpDBusPropertiesMixinClass to use this mixin's implementation of the Messages interface's properties.
This uses tp_message_mixin_get_dbus_property() as the property getter and sets a list of the supported properties for it.

listitem.simpara: The class of an object with this mixin

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_messages_iface_init ()
refsect2.para: Fill in this mixin's Messages method implementations in the given interface vtable.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the TpSvcChannelInterfaceMessagesClass in an object class
Ignored

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_get_dbus_property ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_mixin_get_dbus_property (GObject *object, GQuark interface, GQuark name, GValue *value, gpointer unused);
refsect2.para: An implementation of TpDBusPropertiesMixinGetter which assumes that the object has the messages mixin. It can only be used for the Messages interface.

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin
Must be TP_IFACE_QUARK_CHANNEL_INTERFACE_MESSAGES
A quark representing the D-Bus property name, either "PendingMessages", "SupportedContentTypes" or "MessagePartSupportFlags"
A GValue pre-initialized to the right type, into which to put the value
Ignored

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_sent ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_message_mixin_sent (GObject *object, TpMessage *message, TpMessageSendingFlags flags, const gchar *token, const GError *error);
refsect2.para: Indicate to the message mixin that message submission to the IM server has succeeded or failed.
After this function is called, message will have been freed, and must not be dereferenced.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: An object implementing the Text and Messages interfaces with this mixin
The outgoing message
The flags used when sending the message, which may be a subset of those passed to the TpMessageMixinSendImpl implementation if not all are supported, or 0 on error.
A token representing the sent message (see the Telepathy D-Bus API specification), or an empty string if no suitable identifier is available, or NULL on error
NULL on success, or the error with which message submission failed

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_set_rescued ()
refsect2.para: Mark all pending messages as having been "rescued" from a channel that previously closed.

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_take_received ()
refsect2.para: Receive a message into the pending messages queue, where it will stay until acknowledged, and emit the Received and ReceivedMessage signals. Also emit the SendError signal if the message is a failed delivery report.

listitem.simpara: a channel with this mixin
the message. Its ownership is claimed by the message mixin, so it must no longer be modified or freed

the message ID
since 0.7.21

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_has_pending_messages ()
refsect2.para: Return whether the channel obj has unacknowledged messages. If so, and first_sender is not NULL, the handle of the sender of the first message is placed in it, without incrementing the handle's reference count.

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin
If not NULL, used to store the sender of the oldest pending message
TRUE if there are pending messages

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_clear ()
refsect2.para: Clear the pending message queue, deleting all messages without emitting PendingMessagesRemoved.

listitem.simpara: An object with this mixin

refsect2.title: tp_message_mixin_text_iface_init ()
refsect2.para: Fill in this mixin's Text method implementations in the given interface vtable.
since 0.7.21

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the TpSvcChannelTypeTextClass in an object class
Ignored
